description: JSON Schema generated by XMLSpy v2018 rel. 2 sp1 (x64) (http://www.altova.com)

name.description: Canonical software name assigned by the software developer or service provider.

description.description:
Textual description of the software.
This can be a few sentences copy-pasted from the software homepage.  Minimum 10 and maximum 500 characters.

homepage.description: Homepage of the software, or some URL that best serves this purpose.

biotoolsID.description:
Unique ID (case insensitive) of the tool that is assigned upon registration of the software in bio.tools, normally identical to tool name.
bio.tools IDs are set by bio.tools admin and will be disregarded if specified in a payload (e.g. PUSH, POST) to the bio.tools API.

biotoolsCURIE.description:
bio.tools CURIE (compact URI) based on the bio.tools tool ID.
The bio.tools CURIE is simply the bio.tools tool ID with the prefix "biotools:".
bio.tools CURIEs are set by bio.tools admin and will be disregarded if specified in a payload (e.g. PUSH, POST) to the bio.tools API.

items.description: Version information (typically a version number) of the software applicable to this bio.tools entry.

A unique identifier of the software, typically assigned by an ID-assignment authority other than bio.tools.
This field is not normally used for bio.tools toolIDs, but could be in the exceptional case that multiple such IDs were needed for a given entry.

version.description: Version information (typically a version number) of the software applicable to this identifier.

items.description: Details of a function (i.e. mode of operation) the software provides, expressed in concepts from the EDAM ontology.

The basic operation(s) performed by this software function (EDAM Operation).
An EDAM Operation concept URL and / or term are specified, e.g. "Multiple sequence alignment", http://edamontology.org/operation_0492.

uri.description:
URL of an EDAM Operation concept.
The URL must be in the EDAM Operation namespace, i.e. http://edamontology.org/operation_.

items.description: Details of primary input data.

data.description:
Type of primary input data, if any (EDAM data). 
An EDAM Data concept URL and / or term are specified, e.g. "Protein sequences", http://edamontology.org/data_2976.

items.description: Allowed format(s) of the input data (EDAM Format).
Details of primary output data.

data.description:
Type of primary output data, if any (EDAM Data).
An EDAM Data concept URL and (optionally) term are specified, e.g. "Sequence alignment", http://edamontology.org/data_0863.

items.description: Allowed format(s) of the output data (EDAM Format).

note.description: Concise comment about this function, if not apparent from the software description and EDAM annotations.

cmd.description:
Relevant command, command-line fragment or option for executing this function / running the tool in this mode.
Minimum 1 and maximum 100 characters.

items.description: A type of application software: a discrete software entity can have more than one type.

General scientific domain the software serves or other general category (EDAM Topic).
An EDAM Topic concept URL and / or term are specified, e.g. "Proteomics", http://edamontology.org/topic_0121.

uri.description:
URL of an EDAM Topic concept.
The URL must be in the EDAM Topic namespace, i.e. http://edamontology.org/topic_.

items.description: The operating system supported by a downloadable software.
Name of programming language, e.g. used for the software source code or compatible with an API.

license.description:
Software or data usage license.
Identifier from the SPDX license list (https://spdx.org/licenses/).  In future, based on the supplied license, a label e.g. "Open-source" may be applied to the entry in bio.tools.
Use "Proprietary" where the software must be obtained from the provider (e.g. for money), and is then owned.  Use "Unlicensed" for software which is not licensed and is not proprietary, and "Other" for software under license not currently supported by biotoolsSchema.
Note that for online services, the license attribute refers to the license of the underlying software or data, or a part of those.

items.description: A tag which assigns the software to a collection in bio.tools.

maturity.description: Development stage of the software product.

cost.description: Monetary cost of acquiring the software.

items.description: How freely available the software is for use.
ELIXIR platform.
ELIXIR node.
A miscellaneous link for the software e.g. repository, issue tracker or mailing list.

url.description:
A link of some relevance to the software (URL).
Miscellaneous link.Basic details

type.description: The type of data, information or system that is obtained when the link is resolved.

items.description: A link to a download for the software, e.g. source code, virtual machine image or container.

url.description: Link to download (or repository providing a download) for the software.

type.description: Type of download that is linked to.

version.description: Version information (typically a version number) of the software applicable to this download.

items.description: A link to documentation about the software e.g. manual, API specification or training material.

url.description:
Link to documentation on the web for the tool.
Documentation link.Detailed

type.description: Type of documentation that is linked to.

items.description: A publication about the software.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a publication about the software.

pmid.description: PubMed Identifier (PMID) of a publication about the software.

pmcid.description: PubMed Central Identifier (PMCID) of a publication about the software.

version.description: Version information (typically a version number) of the software applicable to this publication.

items.description: An individual or organisation that should be credited, or may be contacted about the software.

name.description: Name of the entity that is credited.

email.description: Email address of the entity that is credited.

url.description: URL for the entity that is credited, e.g. homepage of an institute.

orcidid.description:
Unique identifier (ORCID iD) of a person that is credited.
Open Researcher and Contributor IDs (ORCID IDs) provide a persistent reference to information on a researcher, see http://orcid.org/.

typeEntity.description: Type of entity that is credited.

items.description: Role performed by entity that is credited.

note.description:
A comment about the credit.
This can elaborate on the contribution of the credited entity.

uri.description:
URL of an EDAM Data concept.
The URL must be in the EDAM Data namespace, i.e. http://edamontology.org/data_.

URL of an EDAM Format concept.
The URL must be in the EDAM  Format namespace, i.e. http://edamontology.org/format_.

biotoolsIdType.description:
bio.tools tool ID.
bio.tools tool IDs are a URL-safe and Linked-Data-safe derivative of (often identical to) the tool name. Allowed characters are uppercase and lowercase English letters (case insensitive!), decimal digits, hyphen, period, and underscore. Spaces can be preserved as underscore ("_").
bio.tools tool IDs are set by bio.tools admin and will be disregarded if specified in a payload (e.g. PUSH, POST) to the bio.tools API.

data.description: Type of data: EDAM Data term(s).

items.description: Allowed format(s) of the data: EDAM Format term(s).

type.description: The type of data or information that is obtained when the link is resolved.

url.description: A link of some relevance to the software (URL).

items.description: An ontology concept term (preferred label or synonym).

textType.description:
Free text with a minimum length of 10 and maximum length of 1000.
Line feeds, carriage returns, tabs, leading and trailing spaces, and multiple spaces are not allowed / will be removed.

versionType.description:
Tool version label or version range.
The name has a 100 character limit and may only contain space, uppercase and lowercase English letters, decimal digits, plus symbol, period, comma, dash, colon, semicolon and parentheses.
